page.title: 16TOURISM IN EAST COKER
page.content: From a{tourists}point of view it's a very{peaceful area with a sleepy {atmosphere.}In parts it is very isolated. The scenery here is beautiful and there are many{leafy,winding lanes.}In one part there's also a reservoir that has a{picnic spot}in which tourists may enjoy a peaceful lunch with a beautiful view over the water.A pleasant area for waalking and relaxing. For those with special interests there are many{buildings of historic {interest,}described on pages 17 and 18. Especially worth seeing are the churches at Sutton Bingham and East Coker. It pays to get out and{walk through {the villages}to absorb the atmosphere and enjoy the cottages and their gardens at close quarters.
